channel.title: Removing a Ingame Banner
channel.description:
I created a Small private server for me and my friends to play on using the Arrgroth client and source but sadly
http://puu.sh/cqbdj/d1c64cb894.jpg
Thank small banner is annoying and me and my friends hate it and have it removed, any tips?

item.title: Removing a Ingame Banner
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“demonto, post:8, topic:547456”]I have tried this and it seems to still be there (i tried re uploading the cache etc and it still did nothing.

on other note i tried to add a model (Admin Godsword) and it won’t use the right model.

I reliese now why it’s not working. It’s the cache that’s making it not work, I looked at the oringial link it links to and it’s has https://www.dropboxusercontent.com/u/

where as mine is https://www.dropboxusercontent.com/s/

Anyone know how i can change it from /s/ to /u/ to fix the cache problem?[/quote]

The /s/ and /u/ are not your issue. Lol.
Dropbox changed their system at one point, so some users are still on the old system (I’d assume it’s to prevent some form of data loss) and everyone that registered after is on the new.

Also, it’d be nice you could stick to 1 issue at a time. It’s easier to help you.

Explain to me how you removed the code that causes the alert to show up, but it still shows up. That’s physically impossible unless you didn’t compile. Because it’d be REALLY hard for the code to execute something that doesn’t exist, you’d get a null pointer.
Can you at least show proof of this unnatural phenomenon?

Read full topic

item.title: Removing a Ingame Banner
item.dc:creator: @demonto demonto
item.description:
@demonto wrote:

I have tried this and it seems to still be there (i tried re uploading the cache etc and it still did nothing.

on other note i tried to add a model (Admin Godsword) and it won’t use the right model.

I reliese now why it’s not working. It’s the cache that’s making it not work, I looked at the oringial link it links to and it’s has https://www.dropboxusercontent.com/u/

where as mine is https://www.dropboxusercontent.com/s/

Anyone know how i can change it from /s/ to /u/ to fix the cache problem?

Read full topic

item.title: Removing a Ingame Banner
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

demonto:

I just tried this, and even looked in the cache but still i cannot find the text…

Doing the tutorial backwards, and removing what he says to add, will completely remove the alert system. You will no longer see the box or the text…

Read full topic

item.title: Removing a Ingame Banner
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

demonto:

Ok well i found the Alert border images. but how do i remove them? i looked in client.java and nothing… Also i added a custom item to the itemdef.java and added the model but ingame it appears as the wrong item.

If you’re trying to remove them. Do this tutorial, backwards.
http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/tutorials/299509-ref-my-new-alert-system-ref.html

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Removing a Ingame Banner
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Uncalled is right, partially.
If you want to remove the logo from the “Banner” (it’s an alert, btw) go into your cache.
Look for the “sprites” folder. Should have images and folder(s). Find the 3 images named “alertback”, “alertborder” and “alertborderh”.
These are the ones you want to modify. Specifically, alertback.

Read full topic

item.title: Removing a Ingame Banner
item.dc:creator: @uncalled_for uncalled for
item.description:
@uncalled_for wrote:

Pretty sure this is a server sided problem.

Okay so go into client.java (Server Side)
and CTRL + f to find “Welcome to Arrgoth!”

You’ll find something like this (MINE WONT LOOK EXACTLY LIKE YOURS):

All you need to do is just comment it out. So just add // infront of the sendMessage it should look like this:

And then compile

Tell me how it goes.

Read full topic
